column3: やがて人――
column4: In time, humans――

column3:
竜の負担を減らし――
より善き未来と――
column4:
Reduce the burden on the dragon—
for a better future—

column3: それは誰の未来か――
column4: Who does that future belong to――

column3: "思念体のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "You can hear the murmurs of the ethereal entity――"

column3:
奴らは知った――
命は等価ではない――
文字通り――
価値がちがう――
column4:
They discovered— 
life holds no equality— 
in a literal sense— 
values vary—

column3:
もう家畜では足りぬ――
もう人でも足りぬ――
column4:
No longer are livestock enough— 
humans are no longer sufficient—

column3:
そして彼らは
エルフを欲した――
column4: And so, they sought after elves—

column3: "思念体のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "You can hear the murmurs of the ethereal entity――"

column3:
連れ去られしエルフが
最後に見るのは巨大な炉
column4:
The last thing seen by the abducted elf 
is a colossal furnace.

column3:
燃える紅蓮の照り返し
赤く染まった敵の顔――
column4:
The fiery red glow 
casts a scarlet hue on the enemy's face.

column3:
表情のない顔、顔、顔――
その中でひとりほくそ笑む男こそ――
column4:
Expressionless faces, faces, faces―― 
Yet one man within smirks――

column3: その男こそすべてを計画せし者――
column4: He is the one who devised it all――

column3: "思念体のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "You can hear the murmurs of the ethereal entity――"

column3:
混じり合う命と石と鋼――
この床の固さは命の強さ
この壁の輝きは命の瞬き
column4:
Life, stone, and steel intertwine— 
The firmness of this floor is the strength of life. 
The brilliance of these walls is life's spark.

column3:
命と物の融合は禁忌の技
王が禁じ、竜が禁じた
しかし彼は密かに続けた
column4:
Merging life with matter is a forbidden technique,
outlawed by both the king and the dragon.
Yet he persisted in secrecy.

column3:
闇を照らす黄金の輝きに
彼の心は魅了され――
column4:
The golden glow that illuminated the darkness
captivated his mind and...

column3: "思念体のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "You can hear the murmurs of the ethereal entity――"

column3:
邪悪の正体王の腹心
錬金術を為す忠臣――
column4:
The true nature of evil is the king's right hand 
A loyal servant devoted to alchemy――

column3: だから王は信じた
column4: Thus, the king trusted.

column3:
王は真実を知らず
友の言葉を信じた
column4:
The king did not know the truth
and believed his friend's words.

column3:
野心をまとった錬金術師――
その言葉も秘術の賜物か
column4:
An alchemist cloaked in ambition— 
Are his words also a boon of hidden magic?

column3:
虚飾に満ちた言葉が照らし――
哀れ我らの王は
闇の中とは知らず――
column4:
Words full of pretense shine forth— 
Our pitiful king, 
Unaware of the darkness—

column3: "思念体のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "You can hear the murmurs of the ethereal entity――"

column3:
邪悪を知った時――
しかし時すでに遅く――
column4:
When I learned of the evil--
it was already too late--

column3:
命で満ちた灼熱の炉――
炉からあふれしエルフの魂――
column4:
A burning furnace filled with life--
The souls of the elves 
overflowing from the furnace--

column3: 輝きを浴びて王は竜に――
column4: Bathed in light, the king became a dragon――

column3: "地縛思念のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "The whispers of the bound spirit can be heard――"

column3:
黄金郷の黄金は地中より来し黄金にあらず
それは無より生まれた黄金

最初は鋼から――
次は石から――
最後は無から――
column4:
First from steel―― 
Next from stone―― 
Finally from nothing――

column3:
永遠の輝き――
無限の繁栄――
column4:
Eternal brilliance--
Infinite prosperity--

column3:
約束された豊かさに人々は酔い――
彼の野望を見過ごした――
column4:
Drunk on the promised abundance, 
the people ignored his ambitions――

column3: "地縛思念のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "The whispers of the bound spirit can be heard――"

column3:
無から有を生み出すこと――
因果の超越――
その具現、不老不死――
column4:
Creating something from nothing―― 
Transcending causality―― 
The manifestation of immortality――

column3:
錬金の究極の目的は
人間の営みを拡大すること――
column4:
The ultimate goal of alchemy is 
to expand human endeavors――

column3:
しかし、錬金を尽くした男――
ディアマンテスは知っていた
column4:
Yet the man who perfected alchemy―― 
Diamantes knew the truth.

column3:
竜の世界の理は――
人間の飛躍を今以上許さぬことを――
column4:
The Order of the Dragon's world―― 
does not allow humanity to leap any further――

column3: "地縛思念のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "The whispers of the bound spirit can be heard――"

column3: ディアマンテスは竜を超えんと欲した
column4: Diamantes desired to transcend the dragon

column3:
白竜がその野心を知っても
錬金術師は諦めず――
好機到来とほくそ笑んだ
column4:
Even after the white dragon discovered 
his aspirations, the alchemist persisted―― 
grinning at the timely opportunity.

column3:
錬金術師は王に説いた――
竜の横暴を――
人が支配する王の世を――
column4:
The alchemist spoke to the king―― 
of the dragon's tyranny―― 
in a world ruled by man――

column3: "地縛思念のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "The whispers of the bound spirit can be heard――"

column3:
誰が悪計しようとも
白竜様がいらっしゃる
column4:
Regardless of who conspires, 
Lord White Dragon is here.

column3:
鬼才とはいえ、人――
人に何ができよう
竜の支配は盤石にして強固
column4:
No matter how brilliant――
what can humans do? 
The dragons' control is 
strong and unyielding.

column3:
しかし、その男厚顔にして
身の程を知らず――
column4:
Yet, that man is brazen 
and unaware of his limits――

column3: ああ、愚かなりディアマンテス
column4: Alas, foolish Diamantes

column3: "地縛思念のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "The whispers of the bound spirit can be heard――"

column3:
空を二竜が舞った
錬成されたいびつな竜――
その翼は黄金色――
column4:
Two dragons danced in the sky 
a twisted dragon, newly forged――
its wings shimmered in gold――

column3:
やがて二竜は共に地に落ち
竜力を減らし――
column4:
Eventually, the two dragons plummeted 
their power diminished――

column3: 台頭したのは愚かなオーク
column4: It was the foolish orcs who rose up

column3: そのオークに滅ぼされし我が故郷――
column4: My homeland, ravaged by those orcs――

column3:
いや――
オークを愚かと誰が笑えよう――
column4:
No— 
who can truly call the orcs foolish—

column3:
エルフの悲劇と我らは呼ぶが――
後世は――
自業自得と断ずるだろう――
column4:
We name it the tragedy of the elves— 
but those who come after will— 
declare it self-inflicted—

column3: "地縛思念のつぶやきが聞こえる――"
column4: "The whispers of the bound spirit can be heard――"

column3:
力を減じた二竜が並び――
魔物が跋扈し――
ディアマンテスの生死は不明――
column4:
The two dragons, having lost their power, align— 
monsters abound— 
and Diamantes' life or death is uncertain—

column3:
オークの臭いがかしこに漂い――
大勢の覚者が生まれた――
column4:
The smell of orcs pervades the area— 
and a multitude of Arisen have emerged—

column3:
それが我らの世界――
それが我らの時代――
column4:
Such is our world— 
such is our age—

column3:
世界の腐敗を止めるのは――
竜が認めた真の覚者か――
column4:
Who can bring an end to the world's decay— 
but the genuine Arisen accepted by the dragon――

column3: "古き思念の声がする――"
column4: "Whispers of ancient will resonate――"

column3:
闇夜に迷うこと――
魔物と対すること――
column4:
To wander in the dark of night— 
to confront the monsters—

column3: 恐怖の種は数知れず――
column4: There are innumerable seeds of terror――

column3: しかし、この恐怖――
column4: Yet, this terror――

column3:
己が身に起こりしことは
想像の外――
column4:
What has befallen me 
is beyond what I could envision—

column3:
我が命――
石とともに――
column4:
My life— 
with the stone—

column3: "古き思念の声がする――"
column4: "Whispers of ancient will resonate――"

column3:
善き人々に見えた――
いや――
善き人々だった
column4:
They looked like good people— 
No— 
They truly were good people.

column3:
道を極めようと――
危ういほど純粋に――
column4:
To master the path— 
With a purity so precarious—

column3:
石を鋼に――
鋼を金に――
column4:
Stone to steel--
Steel to gold--

column3:
世界の秘密を識り――
さらなる高みへ――
column4:
Grasping the world's mysteries— 
Toward further heights—

column3:
悲劇の発端は――
善なる者を導きし、邪悪――
column4:
The catalyst of tragedy is— 
The wicked leading the righteous—

column3: "古き思念の声がする――"
column4: "Whispers of ancient will resonate――"

column3:
彼の言葉が導く未来――
豊かな――
美しき世界――
column4:
The future guided by his words— 
A prosperous— 
A beautiful world—

column3:
永遠の命――
約束された永遠――
column4:
Eternal life--
Eternity promised--

column3: しかし――幻影
column4: But――a specter

column3:
遅かった――
気づいたのは――
我らの命がついえたあと――
column4:
It was too late— 
I realized only— 
After our lives had extinguished—

column3: "古き思念の声がする――"
column4: "Whispers of ancient will resonate――"

column3: わが故郷は汚された――
column4: My native land is sullied――

column3: 恐ろしき魔獣により――
column4: Because of a dreadful creature――

column3:
奪われ――
錬成された同胞の命――
column4:
Usurped— 
The lives of our transmuted kindred—

column3:
灼熱にさらされ――
悪しき者の――力に――
column4:
Subjected to the searing flames— 
Under the might of the wicked—

column3: "古き思念の声がする――"
column4: "Whispers of ancient will resonate――"

column3: 魔獣は愉しんでいた――
column4: The beast reveled in it――

column3:
疲弊した命の再生を――
削れた命の研磨を――
より善き命と交換を――
column4:
The restoration of exhausted spirits— 
The refinement of worn lives— 
The trade for greater existence—

column3: 邪悪は微笑んで誘う――
column4: Evil smiles and invites--

column3:
すべてを奪うために――
約束された種族から
未来を奪うために――
column4:
To seize all— 
To rob the future 
from the destined kind—

column3: "古き思念の声がする――"
column4: "Whispers of ancient will resonate――"

column3:
我らの使命――
大地の歴史を見聞し――
後の世に伝えること
column4:
Our duty— 
To witness the history of the land— 
And pass it on to future generations.

column3: だが、我らの無念はいかに伝えよう――
column4: However, how can we communicate our sorrow――

column3:
まこと憎きは禁忌の術者――
目を向けよ――
邪悪を見逃すな――
column4:
The truly loathsome are those who wield forbidden magic— 
Look closely— 
Do not miss the wickedness—

column3: "すり切れたメモ"
column4: "Tattered note"

column3:
あ、あぁ――ようやく発見した！
ここがオークたちのアジトで間違いない
よし、少しだけ様子を伺った後すぐさま
報告のためグリ
column4:
Ah, finally found it! 
This is definitely the orc hideout. 
Alright, after observing for a bit, 
I'll report back right away.

column3: （文章はとうとつに途切れている）
column4: (The text abruptly cuts off)

column3: "メルゴダの繁栄と滅亡について"
column4: "On the Prosperity and Ruin of Mergoda"

column3:
白竜の覚者たる賢王ゴルゴランの下、
錬金研究の長ディアマンテスの施政により
人々は豊かな暮らしと富、強き兵力を手に入れ、
王都メルゴダは栄華を極めた
column4:
Under the wise king Golgorran, 
The White Dragons' Arisen, 
and the governance of the alchemy chief, 
Diamantes, the people gained wealth, 
a rich life, and strong military power, 
with the capital, Mergoda, 
reaching its peak of prosperity.

column3:
しかしある時、王は忽然と姿を消し
同時期にメルゴダ王宮は黄金の霧に包まれた
column4:
Yet, at a certain time, the king vanished 
without warning, and during that period, 
the Mergoda Royal Palace was wrapped 
in a golden haze.

column3:
霧から天へと飛び立ったのは、黄金色の竜
黄金の竜は、大いなる白竜に戦いを挑んだ
白竜と黄金竜との戦いは熾烈を極め、白竜の
勝利で幕を閉じることとなるが、その闘いのさ中――
column4:
Out of the mist ascended a golden dragon. 
This golden dragon dared to confront the 
mighty white dragon. The struggle between 
the white and golden dragons was fierce, 
concluding with the white dragon's 
triumph, but amid that fierce combat—

column3:
人々もろとも、王都メルゴダは大地ごと
レスタニアから消失し、一夜にして滅びた
column4:
With its inhabitants, the Royal Capital of 
Mergoda was erased from the land, 
vanishing overnight from Lestania.

column3:
《大地の傷跡》その暗き深淵こそが、
かつての繁栄の中心地なのである
column4:
The Scarred Earth, 
that dark abyss, 
was once the focal point 
of a thriving age.

column3: "さる錬金術師の手記"
column4: The notes of an alchemist.

column3:
よし、実験の第一段階は成功だ
この媒体であれば、あの魔物の錬魔化に
耐えることができるだろう――
column4:
Success! The first phase of the experiment 
is complete. This medium should be 
able to endure the monster's 
alchemical transformation.

column3:
あとはセルギウスが、エリクシルの
精製に成功すれば――
column4:
All that remains is for Sergius to 
succeed in the purification of the 
elixir――

column3:
"錬金術法則大全"
"融合と分離の霊薬"
"エリクシルの神秘"
"魔物制御の術と危機管理について"
column4:
"Compendium of Alchemical Laws"
"The Elixir of Fusion and Separation"
"The Mysteries of Elixir"
"The Art of Demon Control 
and Crisis Management "

column3:
――などなど、非常に分厚く
難解なタイトルの本がぎっしりと
本棚を埋めている
column4:
-- and so on.
A wealth of thick and 
complicated titles 
fills the bookshelf.

column3: "命の器・その可能性と展望"
column4: "The Vessel of Life: Its Potential and Prospects"

column3:
純粋なる精にして、なにものでもなく、
なにものにも変じうる力――
すなわち生命を凝縮し純化するならば、それは
竜力と同質のエネルギーに昇華可能である
column4:
Pure essence, void of form, 
yet able to transform—if 
one condenses and purifies life, 
it may ascend to energy 
of the same nature as 
dragon force.

column3:
ゴリアテ運用や錬魔の制御だけではない
十分な竜力を人為的に生み出すことができれば、
世界のありようそのものを改革しうる、
大いなる発明につながるであろう
column4:
It's not just about Goliath operations 
or controlling the magic. If we can 
artificially generate sufficient dragon force, 
it could lead to a great invention 
that reforms the very fabric of the world.

column3:
《命の器》の成功は、人の世に輝かしき
黄金の夜明けをもたらすものである
column4:
The success of the 
Vessel of Life will bring 
a glorious golden dawn 
to the world of man.

column3: "霊薬師の手記"
column4: "Notes of the Spirit Alchemist"

column3:
よし、ヒエニムスの論理なら実験は
次の段階へ移行できる
あの魔物の錬魔であれば、我らの十分な
戦力となるだろう
column4:
Alright, with Hyenimus's reasoning, 
the experiment can shift to the next stage. 
That magical creature will 
be a strong asset for our forces.

column3:
そして、不死の霊薬が安定さえすれば
いずれは我らが長も――！
column4:
And if the elixir of immortality stabilizes, 
our leader will eventually—!

column3: "破れた薄緑の手帳"
column4: "Ripped Pale Green Notebook"

column3:
――あぁ、ここにまで"白い災厄"の
叫びが聞こえる
column4:
Ah, I can hear the cries of the "White Scourge" 
even here.

column3:
今の、残された我々だけであの災厄に
立ち向かうことができるのか
column4:
Can we, the remaining few, 
actually face that scourge?

column3:
魔道弓を携え、アーマへ向かうべき
時か否か――
column4:
Is it the right moment to approach Arma, 
wielding the Magick Bow?

column3: "赤黒く汚れた手記"
column4: "Soiled Reddish Notebook"

column3:
ハイデルに、テルに呪いあれ――！
妻アンヘラを魔女と糾弾し、自死に追い込んだ
者たちをわたしは許さない
column4:
Cursed be Hidell and cursed be Tel!
I will not forgive those who 
condemned my wife, Angela, as a witch 
and drove her to take her own life.

column3:
そして、無視と無関心でうつろな目を
むけ続けた者たちを許さない
10年、50年、100年経とうと――
column4:
And I will not forgive those 
who continued to gaze with hollow eyes 
of indifference and neglect. 
Whether it be 10, 50, 
or even 100 years—

column3:
我が命よ、呪いとなりてこの地を冒したまえ
病となりて者どもを蝕みたまえ――
column4:
My life, take the form of a curse 
and corrupt this land. 
Become a sickness 
and infest these souls—

column3: "黒薔薇模様の手帳"
column4: "Black Rose Motif Journal"

column3:
ふふ、うまくいったわ
愛する夫――愚かでかわいいあのヒトは
思った通り、自ら呪いのいけにえに
なることを選んだ
column4:
Hehe, it worked perfectly. 
My beloved husband— 
that foolish and adorable man 
has chosen, just as I thought, 
to be the offering for the curse.

column3:
呪いが広がり定着すれば
あたしの力はより強くなる――
column4:
As the curse spreads and takes hold,
my power will grow stronger--

column3:
あぁ、待ちきれない
ようやく闇の魔力を得て、不老不滅の
存在になることができる――！
column4:
Oh, I can't wait to finally gain the magic power 
of darkness and become an immortal being--!

column3: ふふふ、あははははははっ！
column4: Hehehe, ahahaha!

column3:
進むべき道は己が胸の中に
未来は選択と武勇により拓かれる
column4:
The path to take lies within your heart. 
The future is forged through choice and valor.

column3:
ようやくここまで辿り着いた
後続の隊員のためにメモを残しておく
この扉はこちらからでは開きそうにないので
別のルートを探すことを勧める
何とか開けようと数時間ムダにしてしまった
column4:
Finally, I have reached this point. 
I will leave a note for the following team. 
This door does not seem to open from here, 
so I recommend searching for another route. 
I wasted several hours trying to force it open.

column3:
奥に進めば何かの手がかりが見つかりそうだが
安全を考えて撤退するか
このまま調査を続けるか、悩ましいところだ――
column4:
Venturing further might reveal some clues, 
but for safety's sake, should I retreat, 
or press on with the investigation? 
It's a difficult choice—

column3: "他のページには何も書かれていない"
column4: "The other pages are blank."

column3:
扉のような図形が３つ、
何かのレバーのような図形が３本描かれている
column4:
Three door-like shapes are depicted, 
with three shapes resembling levers beside them.

column3: "誰かの日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page of someone's diary has fallen"

column3:
ベヘモットを倒し、宝を入手できたのは良かったが
それを塔まで持ち帰るのに苦労した――
column4:
It was satisfying to beat that behemoth and get
treasure from it,
but I had a hard time bringing it back to the
tower...

column3:
戦いの最中だけでなく、
帰り道にすらアイツに苦労させられるとは――
苦労した分、この素材が何に
使えるのかという期待は高まる一方だ
column4:
Not only during the battles,
but even on the way back to that guy I have
suffered hardships...
Due to these struggles, the expectations I have
for what this
material can be used for are rising.

column3:
ここしばらくの収穫は
我ながら好調すぎるほどだ
日頃の感謝もあり、例の情報屋に話してみたが――
column4:
The harvest here has been great for a while and
I've felt the need to show gratitude because of
it.
For example, I spoke to the information broker...

column3:
青い顔になって、そんなものを集めるのは
すぐ止めるようにと強く言われた
なんでも、"良くない運命"を引き寄せるとか――
嘘をついている表情ではないが――
にわかに信じがたい
column4:
They became pale in the face, and said that
collecting
such things must be stopped at once.
Doing anything else, would be inviting "bad
fate"...
By the look on their face, they weren't lying...
It's still hard to believe though.

column3: 向かう所敵無し、これほどの絶好調だと言うのに――
column4:
I'm unbeatable though, and would say this is
going to go perfectly well...

column3: "古い日記のページが落ちている"
column4: "A page from an old diary has fallen down."

column3:
ここも緑の化け物だらけだ――
汚染された空気を吸うと、いつも気分が悪くなる
お世辞にも人に優しい空気には見えないが――
まあ、仕方ない
column4:
This area is crawling with green creatures— 
the polluted air always makes me feel nauseous. 
It's not the kind of air that's gentle on humans, 
but I guess it can't be avoided.

column3:
あの明らかに凶暴そうな、緑の巨人――
今回のお宝は、ヤツだ
あんな化け物は見た事がない――
という事は、珍しいし高く売れると踏んだわけだ
column4:
That clearly brutal-looking green giant— 
that's the prize we're after this time. 
I've never seen a creature like it— 
so I reckon it's unique and will sell for a lot.

column3:
もちろん敵うかは分からないし、危険だが――
上手くいけば、ヤツの奥に眠っている希少石も
いただきだ
両手一杯にして、この《橋向かいの坑道》とおさらばだ
column4:
I don't know if I can actually win, and it's perilous,
but if it goes well, I'll also take the rare stones
that are hidden within it.
With my hands full, I'll be done with this 
《Tunnel Across the Bridge》.

column3:
美しい石だったら、クレアへの土産にしても良いな――
そうだ、ネックレスにしてプレゼントしよう
奴の体毛で編んだチェーンで――
はは、さすがに気持ち悪いかな？
column4:
If it's a pretty stone, I could give it to Cress— 
I'll make it into a necklace for her. 
Using a chain made of its fur— 
Haha, maybe that's a bit too weird?

column3:
この先、地熱異常のため立入禁止とする
鉱員は他坑道の掘削にまわること
column4:
Due to geothermal abnormalities, 
this area is off-limits. 
Miners should proceed to excavate other tunnels.

column3: "日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page out of a diary has fallen down."

column3:
侵食の進んだ、危険な土地ではありましたが――
退治した大型魔物に侵食の気配は無く
今まで同様強敵だったものの、少し安心しました
column4:
Although the land was highly corrupted and
dangerous -
there was no sign of infestation in the large
demons that we eliminated.
And although they were as powerful as ever, we
were a bit relieved.

column3:
しかし、このような土地で侵食されず生息するとは
移り住んだばかりなのか、抗体があるのか――
column4:
However, to live in a land like this without
being infected...
Is it because they just moved in, or do they have
antibodies?

column3:
ベンジャミン様はその美しい魔物からも素材を
回収すると、装備品をまた一つ作成されました
この装備もまた――塔に納めるおつもりなのでしょう
column4:
Master Benjamin collected materials from that
beautiful demon and created another piece of
equipment.
This equipment also intended to be stored in the
tower.

column3:
先日立ち寄った拠点で耳に入って来たのですが――
フィンダムには、偉大な人物が亡くなった際
装具や装飾品を副葬品として埋葬する文化が
あるそうなのです
column4:
I overheard at a stopover the other day-- that
there is a tradition in Phindym where when great
men die, they are buried with ornaments and
ornaments as burial accessories.

column3:
ベンジャミン様がご友人の足跡を巡りながら
作成した装備品を埋葬していくのは――
フィンダムの流儀に則った弔い、なのかもしれません
column4:
Perhaps Master Benjamin, while tracing the
footsteps of his friend, is burying the equipment
he created—an homage following the Phindym
tradition.

column3: "日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page out of a diary has fallen down."

column3:
本当にこのモロー樹林の侵食は、深刻なようです
侵食の治療はなんとか可能であるものの
根本的な原因が何か判明していない以上――
かからないに越したことはありません
column4:
It seems that the corruption of the "Morrow
Forest" has gotten
serious. Although the treatment of corruption is
somehow possible, I do not know
what has initially caused it to form...
It's best that I don't take anything from here.

column3:
今回の探索で、侵食には重度なものになると
より凶暴化し、感染力が上がる事が分かりました
相貌も変化し、正視に耐えられぬ姿になることも――
column4:
During this investigation, I've learned that the
corruption
seems to become more of an issue when it reaches
a severe level. Upon which,
the infectivity increases, and the appearance
changes to form a figure that one
could not bear to look at...

column3:
レスタニアとフィンダムの迷宮を巡り
希少素材を回収する旅も、もう長くなりますが――
column4:
Adventures through the labyrinths of Lestania
and Phindym to collect rare materials, have only
gotten longer...

column3:
ベンジャミン様は集めた素材を
すべて装備品に変え、ご友人が滞在していた地
滞在したであろう地の最奥に
納めていくことを続けておられます
column4:
Master Benjamin gathered all of the materials
collected thus far,
and used them to form equipment here in the land
where your friend had stayed.
In the most remote parts of this place, he
continuously offers up what he has created.

column3:
4部位それぞれで行う――
ということは、残るはあと2ヶ所
真意は分かりかねますが、我々は付き従うのみです
column4:
"Do this in each of the four sites"...
That means there are two sites still remaining.
We may not understand the intention behind this,
but we tag along regardless.

column3:
後続の隊員へ
この扉はこちら側からは
開かない仕組みになっているようだ
column4:
To the next team, 
it seems this door cannot 
be opened from this side.

column3:
私たちは別の通路から回って
奥へ進入を試みることにする
――アンニーナ
column4:
We'll try advancing deeper via 
a different route. 
――Annina

column3:
俺も記念に一筆！　全く寒すぎる
駐屯地に戻ったら、ここに来る時は
上着を持参するように報告しといた方がいいな
――レオナルド
column4:
I'll leave a note too! It's freezing out here. 
Once we get back to the camp, 
I'll make sure to report 
that we should bring coats 
next time we come here. 
――Leonard

column3: "他のページには何も書かれていない"
column4: "The other pages are blank."

column3: "誰かの日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page of someone's diary has fallen"

column3:
あの話は本当だったのか――
氷魔がごく稀に落とすという
強力な希少素材――
column4:
Was the story true?
The one about the ice demon that drops a powerful
rare material?

column3:
村の情報屋が言うことには
今までその姿かたちを見た者はいないらしい
column4:
The information broker in the village said that
there has been nobody that has seen the figure
until just now.

column3:
ならばなぜ、情報屋がその存在を知っているのか？
そんな怪しい話、どうせ戯言に違いないと
たかをくくっていたが――
column4:
So pray tell, how does the information broker
know of its existence?
Such a suspicious story, it must be a load of
crap...

column3:
まさか本当に存在していたとはな！
ああ、触れているだけで
手のひらがピリピリと痛むほどの冷気を感じる
どれほどの魔力を秘めているのか――
column4:
It certainly did exist, and must've existed for a
while now!
Oh, just touching it has made a painful tingling
chill linger in my palm.
Just how much magical power is hidden within
it...?

column3:
他にもこういった物が無いか
調べてみる価値はあるな――
column4:
Are there others like this?
It may be worth investigating further...

column3:
この先は危険度の高い魔物が
棲みついていることが判明している
十分な装備を整えた隊員のみ
調査に加わるよう留意すべし
――ベルトラン
column4:
It has been confirmed that highly dangerous 
monsters inhabit the area ahead. Only team 
members with adequate equipment 
should join the investigation. 
――Bertrand

column3: "誰かの日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page of someone's diary has fallen"

column3:
俺も腕には自信があるつもりだが、
正直言って今回はヒヤリとさせられた――
侵食されたグリフィンとは、これほど凶暴なものか
column4:
I am confident in my weapons, but if I am honest,
this time I may have made a mistake...
Is this Infected Griffin as ferocious as they say?

column3:
さすがに今回ばかりは、落命すら覚悟した
まだ命がある事、感謝せねば――
column4:
As one would expect, even though I was prepared
to die,
I still live, and I must not take that for
granted...

column3:
ともあれ、そろそろ収集物も増えてきた――
持ち歩くにも動きづらいため
ひとまとまりにして保管しておくことにしよう
column4:
Anyway, my collection has recently grown in
size...
I've decided to keep it all in one place, as it
is getting hard
to carry it around everywhere with me.

column3:
魔物の巣になるばかりの
うち捨てられた建物があった
村に置き去るよりは、そこの方が安心だろう
column4:
There was an abandoned building nearby.
It would be much more secure to put it there,
than to leave it
in the village, only for it to become some
monster's nest.

column3:
印象的なその姿――
我がアジトを『塔』と名付けよう
column4:
What an impressive figure...
My own secret hideout, I'll call it the "Tower".

column3:
対極に住まう門番を破れば
道は開ける
column4:
Defeat the gatekeeper dwelling in opposition, 
and the path will open.

column3: "他のページは文字がかすれて読めそうにない"
column4:
"The writing on the other pages is too faint to
read."

column3: "筆跡が新しい日記のページが落ちている"
column4:
"The handwriting is from a page that has fallen
out of a new diary."

column3:
これほどに醜く、滑稽な姿の魔物は見た事が無い
変な話だが――自分があの魔物として
生まれなかった事に、感謝を覚えてすらいる
column4:
It's strange that I have never previously seen
demons of such an ugly,
comical figure like this...I should remember to
be thankful, to have not been born into
this world as one of those demons.

column3:
戦いを重ねるごとに、憎めなく思えてきたが――
愛着が湧く前に、希少素材が入手できて良かった
column4:
Whenever I had fought a battle, my mind was clear
of hatred...
It was good that rare materials made themselves
available before I got too
hot-headed.

column3:
さらに、戦いの中でこの地の魔物が
使っていた武器を入手する事もできた
故郷で流通していた物よりも
高度に鍛えられている
column4:
In addition, by battling the demon that laid
claim to
this place, I was able to get the weapon I had
been using forged to a
higher quality than those circulating around my
hometown.

column3:
新たに訪れたこの地で、まだまだ知らない事は多い
素材だけでなく、多くの知識も
持ち帰る事ができそうだ
column4:
There are many things still unknown to me about
this
new place. Perhaps I may not only bring materials
home, but also a
wealth of knowledge.

column3: 起こるのは良い事ばかり――心配は杞憂だったのだ
column4:
Only good things have occurred...I was needlessly
worried.

column3: "日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page out of a diary has fallen down."

column3:
この大陸は、その気候や生態、文化など
全てにおいて異なる点が多く見られます
column4:
On this continent, the climate, ecology, culture,
and etc,
are all so different than everything we knew.

column3:
特に、この水路で見たあのサルのような魔物――
姿形はレスタニアに生息しているものに
似ていますが、決定的に違うのは、そのトゲ――
column4:
Particularly, monsters like the ape we had seen
in this waterway..
Its appearance is similar to those inhabiting
Lestania,
but decisively different, because of those
thorns...

column3:
しかしこの魔物からも、レスタニアでは見る事の無い
希少な素材を回収できました
これで、水路に降りた目的を達成したはずです
column4:
However, from this demon we were able to recover
one of the rare materials that did not exist in
Lestania.
With this, we should have achieved the purpose of
why we came into this waterway.

column3:
――ベンジャミン様は
ご友人の遺体と日記を発見してから
以前にも増して寡黙になられたようです――
column4:
...Master Benjamin seems to become more withdrawn
the more we stumble upon the diaries of his
acquaintances who have likely
fallen...

column3:
時折、酷く悔しそうな表情をされます――
しかしその真意までは
ポーンの私には判らないのです
column4:
Occasionally, I will have a look of chagrin on my
face...
but the intention behind it, is one that my pawn
can't understand.

column3: "筆跡が新しい日記のページが落ちている"
column4:
"The handwriting is from a page that has fallen
out of a new diary."

column3:
見た目は何ともおぞましく
邪悪な魔法は強力だったが
叩き落としてしまえば、たやすいものだった――
column4:
What a horrible sight.
Dark magic worked incredibly well against it,
and when it was knocked down, it was easy to slay
it...

column3:
こんな魔物に、数多の人々が言葉無き姿に
変えられたかと思うと、何ともやるせない
column4:
To think that many people were changed into
speechless statues
by such a demon, is deeply depressing...

column3:
ともあれ、希少素材は入手した
せめてメドゥーサの犠牲となった人々に
安らかな眠りが与えられるよう――祈るしかない
column4:
Anyway, as soon as we collect the rare material
from it,
we have to say a prayer for the souls that have
fell victim at the hands of the Medusa...
I have no choice but to pray...

column3:
この素材に、どれだけの
人間の怨念が込められているか
いや――今まで集めてきた全てが
同じ宿因にあるのだろう
column4:
This material...
Are there remnants of human grudges is trapped
within?
It's unpleasant...but it seems to be used for the
same purpose as
everything else we've collected up until now in
the inn.

column3:
――それを考えれば、集めると
"良くない運命"を引き寄せるという
いつか聞いた話も頷けるように思う
column4:
...Given that, if one collects things like these
they say it will invite a "bad fate".
I think the stories I've heard will someday
become true...

column3: "誰かの日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page of someone's diary has fallen"

column3:
危ない所だった――
ただでさえ怪力で厄介なサイクロプスが
侵食によって、およそ生物とは
思えない力を発揮していた
column4:
It was a dangerous place...
Even a simple Cyclops, already troublesome due to
its sturdiness,
was demonstrating an unexpected strength when
corrupted by these strange
organisms.

column3:
まともに相手をしていたら、今頃命は無かっただろう
今こうして日記を書いている手も、震えが止まらない
column4:
If I did not have a decent partner, I would not
currently be alive.
Even as I write this, my hands cannot stop
trembling.

column3:
なんとか手に入れたこのおぞましい貴重素材――
見た目はひどいものだが、
祈祷師や好事家あたりが見れば大喜びするだろう
column4:
I did manage to acquire this valuable and hideous
material somehow...
Although it's a terrible sight to behold, you
would be delighted to see the prices the
shamans and dilettantes have offered for it.

column3:
しかし、金にするのが本当に正しい用途なのか？
もっと集めることで、何か作り出せるのかもしれない
column4:
But, is this really the right way to use it;
making money?
Perhaps by gathering more, something useful might
be made from it.

column3:
例えば、それが武器だとしたら――
大きな力を持つはずだ
column4:
For example, if formed into a weapon...it should
be imbued with great power.

column3: 扉は遺跡の守護者によって末永く守られるだろう――
column4:
The door will be protected by the guardians of
the ruins for all eternity――

column3: "日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page out of a diary has fallen down."

column3:
遺跡の奥底に坐していたあの魔物――
レスタニアに生息しているそれと姿形は似ているけど
より凶暴で、俊敏だったように感じます
column4:
That demon dwelling within the depths of the
ruins...
It looks similar to those that inhabit Lestania,
but feels far more
ferocious and agile.

column3:
それとは別に、見知った魔物も見かけました
同様の進化を遂げたのか、何らかの手段で
向こうからこちらへ渡って来たのか――
column4:
That aside, I also saw a monster I recognized.
Have you evolved in a similar way by some means?
Did you cross over to here from there...?

column3:
しかし、我々の知っていた倒し方が通用したせいか
ベンジャミン様は少し興奮しておられるようでした
column4:
However, it seemed that Benjamin was a bit excited
because the method of killing we knew had worked.

column3:
ベンジャミン様の命でこの日記をつけるように
なってから、心の機微と出来事のつながりが
整理でき、人の感情が推測できるように
なってきた気がします――
column4:
Since I had begun to record Benjamin's life in
this diary,
I feel it is now possible to organize the link
between the subtleties of the mind,
and the events of one's life to better understand
how they feel...

column3:
この調子で、もう少し――
主人の心に寄り添えるポーンになりたいものです
column4:
In this manner, just a little further...
I'll become a pawn that is closer to my master's
heart.

column3: "日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page out of a diary has fallen down."

column3:
最後の戦いは、壮絶を極めました
侵食の悪魔――
相手はまさに、その言葉にふさわしい怪物でした
column4:
The final battle was truly epic. The demon of
infection—our adversary was undoubtedly a monster
befitting those words.

column3:
最後の力を振り絞り、何とか止めを刺したものの――
我々従者は深手を負ってしまったのです
column4:
We mustered our last ounce of strength and
managed to strike the finishing blow, but as a
result, we, the servants, sustained serious
injuries.

column3:
傷つき、動けない我々を残し
ベンジャミン様は一人、行ってしまわれました
目的を達するためには足手まといは不要――
そういうことなのでしょう
column4:
Leaving us wounded and immobilized behind, Master
Benjamin went on alone. To achieve the objective,
we can't have anything slowing us down—perhaps
that was the reason.

column3:
導きを失った私たちは
ただ愚直に、主の帰りを待つことしかできません
最後の魔窟殿へ独りで向かった、傷だらけの主を――
column4:
We, who have lost our guidance, can do nothing
but earnestly await the return of our master. Our
master, who ventured alone to the final demon's
lair, battered and bruised.

column3:
戻られたあの方を暖かく迎えるため
一体何をすべきか、ベンジャミン様と交わした言葉を
思い起こしながら考えてみようと思います
column4:
I will think about what we should do to warmly
welcome them back based on the words exchanged
with Master Benjamin, with the aim of greeting
them upon their return.

column3: "手記と思われる紙の切れ端が落ちている"
column4: "Scraps of a paper note seem to have fallen down."

column3:
魔物を狩り、呪われた宝から
鎧を造りだす時間を除けば
一時も休むことなく進み、彼の痕跡を追っている
column4:
Between hunting demons, and putting aside time to
craft armor from the cursed treasure...
I have no time to take breaks, and must carefully
retrace his steps.

column3:
だが、フィンダムでの無理が祟り
咳は酷くなる一方で、従者どもに心配された
column4:
However, this cursed land of Phindym has given me
an unnatural cough, which has made my pawns
worried.

column3:
いや、正しくは「そう見える」と言うべきか
彼らがまるで人間のような仕草を見せるたび
怖気と虚しさを感じるのだ
column4:
No, I should say they "look like they are".
Everytime they show a gesture or expression like
a human being,
it feels unnerving and empty.

column3:
家族も故郷も失い、救いを求めて心臓を捧げ
得たものがこんな傀儡だったとは――
工作や戦いの腕が優れているとはいえ
当時は愕然としたものだ
column4:
To lose my family and hometown, seeking salvation
and dedicating my heart,
only to receive a puppet such as this...
Although their inherent skill in crafting and
combat are outstanding, at the time,
I was appalled.

column3:
弔いをしてやれるような――
生涯で友と言える相手は、彼くらいだろう
column4:
I'm going to mourn...
The partner that would be known as a friend in
his life, they would not be able to.

column3: "分厚いノートが落ちている"
column4: "A thick notebook lies abandoned"

column3:
ようやくミスリウ古墳墓に入ることができた！
解放を要請し続けてきたかいがあったというもの！
さて、この扉の向こうに何かが見えるが
こちらからは行けそうにない
column4:
At last, I've managed to enter 
the Mysree Barrow! 
All those requests for access paid off! 
Now, I can see something beyond this door, 
but it doesn't seem I can reach it from here.

column3:
過去に扉が開いた形跡があることから
何らかの手段で扉を開けることができるはずだ
とりあえず、他の道から探索してみよう
ああ、胸が躍って仕方がない――
column4:
The door shows evidence of 
being opened in the past, 
so there must be some way to open it. 
For now, let's explore another route. 
Ah, I can't contain my excitement――

column3: "筆跡が新しい日記のページが落ちている"
column4:
"Bad fate"
...Aah, have you been creeping up on me without a
sound?

column3:
数多の魔物を打ち倒し、
実力をつけていく手応えは確かに感じていた――
だからこそ、慢心があったのかもしれない
column4:
I certainly felt the way to put my skills to the
test,
was to defeat a multitude of monsters...
Perhaps I was too overconfident in my ability.

column3:
先の戦いで手負いだとしても、油断があったとしても
こうも簡単に囲まれるとは情けない――
column4:
Even if you purposely throw the previous battle,
and even if you
were unprepared, it is pitiful to be surrounded
as easily as this...

column3:
暗闇の先から、盗賊たちの息遣いが聞こえる
この緊張を破るきっかけがあれば、
飢えた狼のように一斉に飛びかかる気なのだろう
column4:
From the darkness, you can hear the thieves
breathing as
they wait for a chance to break the tension in
the air.
Perhaps they're going to jump out and strike in
unison like starving wolves.

column3:
全てを塔に置いてきたことだけが、唯一の救いだ
あの妖しき宝は、盗賊ごときに渡すのは惜しいからな
column4:
Putting everything into the tower, may prove to
be my salvation.
That bewitching treasure, it would be regrettable
to hand it over to someone such as a thief.

column3:
"良くない運命"
――あぁ、音も無く忍び寄られていたのか
column4:
"Bad fate"
...Aah, have you been creeping up on me without a
sound?

column3: "古びた手記が打ち捨てられている"
column4: A faded record is left behind.

column3:
お可哀想なお嬢様
あんな男のもとへ嫁いだばかりに
反逆の罪の身代わりとされ
このようなところへ幽閉されるとは
column4:
How pitiful the young lady is, 
married off to such a man, 
only to be blamed for treason 
and imprisoned in this place.

column3:
この無念、必ずやわたくしが
晴らさせてさしあげます
例えこの身がどうなろうとも
column4:
I will surely avenge this grievance, 
even if it costs me my life.

column3:
冥府でのお嬢様が
もう泣かずにすみますように
column4:
May the young lady in the underworld 
no longer need to weep.

column3: "次のページは燃えて消し炭になっている"
column4: "The following page is charred to cinders."

column3: "手記と思われる紙の切れ端が落ちている"
column4: "Scraps of a paper note seem to have fallen down."

column3:
従者が時たま、本当に人の心を
持っているのではないかと錯覚するような
表情を見せるようになってきた――
column4: Occasionally, a follower has a truly human heart.

column3:
今までろくに話もしなかったことを後悔しそうだ
身体がひどく弱っているせいで
精神が落ち込みやすくなっているのだろうか
column4:
I'm starting to regret not having spoken much
until now. Could it be that my spirit is easily
downcast because my body is in such a weakened
state?

column3:
心の奥底で、凶暴な衝動が
揺らめくのも感じるのだ
今まで見てきたおぞましい魔物のように
私も変わってしまうのだろうか――
column4:
Deep in my heart, I can feel the flickering of a
violent impulse. Just like the hideous enemies I
have seen before, will I also end up
changing—transforming into something horrifying?

column3:
長く関わりすぎたのだ
大きな力を持つ物は人を強く引きつけるが
それが淀み――侵されていれば、悲劇を呼ぶ
column4:
It is because they possess great power that they
strongly attract people, but if that power
stagnates or is invaded, it will bring tragedy.

column3:
残すは遙かに見える塔のみ
頼もしき従者と共に
どうか、辿り着かせてくれ――竜よ
column4:
All that remains is the tower in the distance.
Please, with my reliable attendants, guide me to
reach it, oh, Dragon.

column3: "日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page out of a diary has fallen down."

column3:
驚くべき発見です！
ピクシーが、これほど高度な社会的序列を築いて
いたとは――しかも、その強固さは
比較対象にされることの多いゴブリン以上です
column4:
It is a surprising discovery!
I had no idea that Pixies had built such a high
level of social hierarchy - and moreover, its
strength is greater than that of the commonly
compared Goblin.

column3:
ベンジャミン様はいつになくご機嫌が良いようで
なんと――ご自分のことを
少し話してくださいました！
column4:
Mr. Benjamin seemed to be in an unusually good
mood and, by golly--he told us a little about
himself!

column3:
まず、亡きご友人について
フィンダム人唯一の友人であること――
彼の志に敬意を表し、弔いの旅を続けていること――
column4:
First and foremost, I pay my respects to my late
comrade, the only friend of a Phindymian. I
continue my journey in tribute to his aspirations
and in mourning.

column3:
さらに、旅が終わったら二度と
このようなことが起きないよう
冒険者の集いを作り、助け合えるように
したいということ
column4:
Furthermore, once our journey comes to a conclusion,
I wish to establish a gathering of adventurers
to ensure that such events never happen again,
and to foster mutual assistance in the future.

column3:
そして最も感動したのは、我々にも
その一端を担わせてくださるということ――
ポーンでありながら、仲間として
認められたような気さえしました
column4:
And what moved me the most was that we were
allowed to play a part in it as well. Even as
pawns, it felt like we were recognized as
companions.

column3: "手記と思われる紙の切れ端が落ちている"
column4: "Scraps of a paper note seem to have fallen down."

column3:
これで全てが終わる――
いつか誰かに暴かれるまで、私とフィネガンは
ここに永遠の眠りにつくのだ
column4:
This is the end of everything— 
Until someone reveals the truth, 
Finnegan and I will rest here forever.

column3:
辿り着いた者たちよ
ここまで来るには多くの苦難があったことだろう
我が身はここで朽ちるとも
遺した従者たちが志を継ぐ
column4:
To those who have made it here, 
you must have overcome many trials 
to arrive at this moment. 
Even as I perish, 
my devoted followers 
will continue my legacy.

column3:
彼女らには気の毒なことをした――
だが遺されし者が生き抜き、事を成すためには
微かでも希望が必要なのだ
column4:
I have wronged them greatly— 
yet for those who remain to survive 
and achieve their goals, 
a glimmer of hope is essential.

column3:
黄金を纏うに相応しき勇者たちよ
従者の手を借りて冒険者の集い場を作り――
仲間と共に脅威へ立ち向かえ
column4:
Heroes fit to wear gold, 
with the support of your allies, 
forge a meeting place for adventurers— 
unite against the perils ahead.

column3:
冷たい石の上、独り命を落とす者が
もう二度と出ることのないように――
column4:
Upon this frigid stone, let no one 
else perish alone ever again—

column3: "日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page out of a diary has fallen down."

column3:
侵食されている魔物の行動には、
いくつかのパターンが見られます
column4:
There are several patterns observed in the
behavior of the infected creatures.

column3:
とにかく凶暴性が助長されるもの
侵食前と変わらない行動サイクルを持つもの
そしてこの魔物のように侵食から逃れようと
もがき苦しむもの――
column4:
There are those whose aggressiveness is
exacerbated, those that maintain the same
behavioral cycle as before infection, and those
like this creature, who struggle in agony, trying
to escape from the corruption.

column3:
その姿は哀れを誘いますが――
侵食によって箍の外れた力は、一瞬でも
気を緩めればこちらが命を落とすほどです
column4:
Their appearance evokes pity, but the power
unleashed by Corruption is so dangerous that even
a momentary lapse in concentration could cost us
our lives.

column3:
この度の魔物は強敵でしたが
それ以上に苦戦しました
ベンジャミン様の動きが鈍く、我々が
それを庇っていたためです
column4:
The creatures we faced this time were formidable
foes, but what made it even more challenging was
that Master Benjamin's movements were slow, and we
were protecting him.

column3:
このままでは、ベンジャミン様のご友人を弔うはずが
我々自身の弔い旅になってしまうかもしれません
帰還し、ゆっくり休養いただけるまであと少し――
column4:
If this continues, our journey to mourn Master
Benjamin's late friend might turn into our own
mourning journey. We'll have to return and rest a
little while longer until Master Benjamin can
recuperate.

column3: "日記の１ページが落ちている"
column4: "A page out of a diary has fallen down."

column3:
この森の最奥で待ち構えていた魔物は
一度対峙した記憶のある魔物――
その腕力は相変わらず脅威でしたが
危なげなく突破することができました
column4:
The creature that lay in wait at the deepest part
of this forest was a creature I had once faced
before. Its strength remained as formidable as
ever, but we were able to overcome it without much
trouble.

column3:
癒しの力を当てることで
あの奇妙な触手の威力を
一定時間抑えることができるようなのです
column4:
It seems that applying the power of healing can
temporarily suppress the strange tentacles' power.

column3:
ところで――
最近は侵食されている魔物と対峙することが多く
ベンジャミン様はよく咳き込み
どこか苦しそうなご様子です
column4:
By the way -
Recently, Master Benjamin has been facing many
infected enemies, and often coughs with a somewhat
painful appearance.

column3:
覚者は竜の力を得ているとはいえ
病には罹りますし、ごくゆっくりと老衰もする――
一言で申し上げるならば、心配です
column4:
While Arisen possess the power of the dragon,
they can still fall ill, and age gradually as
well. In a word, it is a cause for concern.

column3:
どうも、後ろ向きなことばかり考えてしまいます
「弔い」という目的を果たした時
あの方はどうなってしまわれるのでしょう
最悪の場合を想像してしまう私を、お許しください
column4:
I find myself constantly dwelling on negative
thoughts. When we achieve the "mourning" purpose,
I wonder what will become of that person. Please
forgive me for imagining the worst-case scenario.

column3: "手記と思われる紙の切れ端が落ちている"
column4: "Scraps of a paper note seem to have fallen down."

column3: "塔"とは一体、どこにあるのだろう？
column4: This "Tower" of his, where the heck is it?

column3:
用心深い彼のことだ、たやすく見つかる場所に
あるとは思っていないが――
日記によると、全てをそこに置いてきたのだとか
column4:
He's very cautious, so I don't think he's in a
place
that can be easily found...
According to the diary, he says everything has
been placed there?

column3:
「全て」がすなわち宝を意味するならば
盗賊を警戒して巧妙に隠す意図も理解できる
――物に執着があるとは、少々意外だったが
column4:
If by everyhing he means "treasure",
you can understand his intention to hide it from
any would-be thieves.
...It's still a bit surprising that there is an
obsessed with such
things though.

column3:
とはいえ、彼の足取りを順に追っていけば
いつかは"塔"に辿り着くだろう
column4:
Nevertheless, if we retrace his steps
we will arrive at the tower in due time.

column3:
彼が命尽きる時まで追い求めた宝――
その遺志を継ぎ、形にして納めることで
彼と私、お互いにとって良い弔いになるはずだ
column4:
The treasure that he had chased after until the
time of his death...
By carrying on his will, and shaping it, both he
and I, will have lavish funerals.

column3:
なんだってこんなところに来てしまったんだろう
王家の秘密を暴こうなんて、好奇心から忍び込んだはいいが
どちらに進んでも恐ろしい魔物がいた
column4:
What led me to this place? 
I snuck in, driven by curiosity 
to uncover the royal family's secrets, 
but fearsome monsters lurk in every direction.

column3:
物語でみるような"正解の道"なんてありゃしない
必死でここまで戻ったが、背中と足が血まみれだ
column4:
There's no "correct path" like in a story. 
I fought desperately to return here, 
but my back and legs are soaked in blood.

column3:
――手と頭のてっぺんが冷たい
家に帰りたい
でももう歩けそうにない
column4:
My hands and head feel cold. 
I want to go home, 
but I don't think I can walk anymore.

column3: 鍵は"赤くて小さくてカラい　そして隠れる"――
column4:
The key is "small, red, and flavorful,
yet hidden away."

column3:
英霊たちが守る試練の道
始祖の遺しし力が眠る長き道
column4:
The trials' path, watched over by
heroic spirits, holds the founder's
legacy of power in repose.

column3:
力を手にするにふさわしき戦士こそ
先へと導かれるであろう
column4:
A warrior fit to wield power
will surely be guided ahead.

column3:
第一の試練を切り抜けし覚者よ
そなたに更なる力を授ける―――(仮）
column4: unused

column3:
暗がりより起き上がる死者の慟哭を聞け
数多の妄執が試練として絡みつく
column4:
Hear the wailing of the dead rising from the 
darkness. Countless obsessions entwine as 
trials to challenge you.

column3:
しかし戦士はその歩みを
一歩たりとも乱されてはならない
己の清浄を保ち進む者にこそ、道は続く
column4:
Yet the warrior must not let their steps 
be disturbed, even by a single stride. 
Only those who maintain their purity 
and advance shall find the path ahead.

column3:
第二の試練を切り抜けし覚者よ――
そなたに更なる力を授ける―――
column4:
To the Arisen who has overcome the Second Trial―
I grant you even more strength――

column3:
悪意は地を駆け、空を舞う
響く咆哮は試練の始まりを告げる
column4:
Malice runs across the land and 
soars through the sky. 
The echoing roar announces 
the beginning of the trial.

column3:
一度たりとも膝をつくことなく、
魔物の生命力を変質させたのちに
倒した者にこそ、道は続く
column4:
Never once kneeling, 
those who transform the life force 
of monsters and defeat them shall 
find the path ahead.

column3:
第三の試練を切り抜けし覚者よ――
そなたに更なる力を授ける―――
column4:
To the Arisen who has overcome the Third Trial――
I grant you even more strength――

column3:
手は幼子を撫で、私欲のために他者を打ち倒す
腕持つ身と対峙し、己が手と向き合う時が来た
column4:
A hand that comforts a child, yet harms others 
for greed, must stand against its counterpart. 
The moment to face your own hand has come.

column3:
一度たりとも膝をつくことなく、
すみやかに敵を打ち倒す者にこそ、道は続く
column4:
The path continues only for those who never kneel 
and swiftly strike down their foes.

column3:
第一の試練を切り抜けし覚者よ――
そなたに更なる力を授ける―――
column4:
To the Arisen who has overcome the First Trial―
I grant you greater strength――

column3:
暗がりに浮かぶ背中は自らの姿に似ている
己を己たらしめるのはその魂か、あるいは腕か
column4:
In the shadows, the figure looks like you. 
Is it the soul or the strength 
that shapes your being?

column3:
猛き戦士は己を見失うことはない
迅く清浄な足取りで
総ての障りを打ち砕く者にこそ、道は続く
column4:
The mighty warrior keeps their sense of self, 
with quick and pure strides, 
the road extends only for those 
who crush every hindrance.

column3:
第四の試練を切り抜けし覚者よ――
そなたに更なる力を授ける―――
column4:
To the Arisen who has overcome the Fourth Trial――
I grant you even more strength――

column3:
アッカーシェランを襲いし脅威を直視せよ
幻として招かれた脅威は
しかして実体を持って戦士を試す
column4:
Face the threat that assails Acre Selund
The danger summoned as a phantom
Will manifest to challenge the warrior

column3:
魔物の枷をすべて解き放ち
その生命力を変質させたのちに
倒した者にこそ、最後の道程が開かれる
column4:
Break all the restraints of the beast
After altering its vitality
Only those who conquer it 
will find the final path

column3:
ここは武神の試練――
この試練は他の試練とは比べ物にならない――
column4:
Here lies the War God's trial――
This trial is unlike any other――

column3:
この試練を切り抜けられた覚者には
王家に伝わる武具を授ける――
column4:
To the Arisen who overcomes this trial,
royal weapons shall be bestowed.

column3:
さらなる脅威へと挑みし者よ
王家に仇なす存在を打ち倒さんとする者よ
その力と志を示し、先へ進まんとする者よ
column4:
You who confront rising threats,
you who strive to vanquish foes of the royal family,
demonstrate your power and purpose, and advance.

column3:
英霊に導かれし戦士は、長き道の果てに
今こそ始祖の遺しし力を手にするだろう
column4:
A warrior led by the spirits of heroes 
will finally grasp the ancient power 
after a long path.

column3:
第二の試練を切り抜けし覚者よ――
そなたに更なる力を授ける―――
column4:
To the Arisen who has overcome the Second Trial―
I grant you even more strength――

column3:
アッカーシェランの国土を駆ける生命は
いまや大地と同じく囚われ苛まれる
column4:
The life that races across the territory of 
Acre Selund is now as imprisoned and tormented 
as the very land itself.

column3:
哀れな生命力を変質させたのち
すみやかに魔物を倒した者にこそ、道は続く
column4:
Only those who change the pitiful life force 
and swiftly slay the monsters shall continue 
on their journey.

column3:
第三の試練を切り抜けし覚者よ――
そなたに更なる力を授ける―――
column4:
To the Arisen who has overcome the Third Trial――
I grant you even more strength――

column3:
見よ、アッカーシェランに生まれし
総ての生命から平穏は奪われた
column4:
Behold, peace has been taken from all 
life born in Acre Selund.

column3:
一度たりとも膝をつくことなく、
持ち込んだ物品に頼らずに
己の力で敵を打ち倒す者にこそ、道は続く
column4:
Never kneeling even once, 
and without depending on supplies, 
only those who vanquish foes 
through their own might will continue.

column3:
第四の試練を切り抜けし覚者よ――
そなたに更なる力を授ける―――
column4:
To the Arisen who has overcome the Fourth Trial――
I grant you even more strength――

column3:
国を覆う脅威を見定めよ
今こそ歪な魂を直視しなければならない
哀れな亡骸から造られし、その生命を
column4:
Identify the threat that blankets the land. 
Now is the time to confront the twisted soul, 
the life created from the wretched remains.

column3:
持ち込んだ物品に頼らず
すみやかに敵を打ち倒す者にこそ
最後の道程が開かれる
column4:
The final journey opens for those 
who swiftly vanquish foes 
without depending on carried goods.

column3:
さらなる脅威へと挑みし者よ
王家に仇なす存在を打ち倒さんとする者よ
その力と志を示し、先へ進まんとする者よ
column4:
You who confront rising threats,
you who strive to vanquish foes of the royal family,
demonstrate your power and purpose, and advance.

column3:
英霊に導かれし戦士は、長き道の果てに
今こそ始祖の遺しし力を手にするだろう
column4:
A warrior led by the spirits of heroes 
will finally grasp the ancient power 
after a long path.

column3:
ここは武神の試練――
この試練は他の試練とは比べ物にならない――
column4:
Here lies the War God's trial――
This trial is unlike any other――

column3:
この試練を切り抜けられた覚者には
王家に伝わる武具を授ける――
column4:
To the Arisen who overcomes this trial,
royal weapons shall be bestowed.

column3:
英霊たちが守る試練の道
始祖の遺しし力が眠る長き道
column4:
The trials' path, watched over by
heroic spirits, holds the founder's
legacy of power in repose.

column3:
力を手にするにふさわしき戦士こそ
先へと導かれるであろう
column4:
A warrior fit to wield power
will surely be guided ahead.

column3:
英霊たちが守る試練の道
始祖の遺しし力が眠る長き道
column4:
The trials' path, watched over by
heroic spirits, holds the founder's
legacy of power in repose.

column3:
力を手にするにふさわしき戦士こそ
先へと導かれるであろう
